title: Rate my note taking setup
text:
Very simple. 
Private Github repo.
Write from anywhere using github.dev/<repo_path>
Use mobile Github app and favorite repo for on the fly read access.
Use VScode to access every extension imaginable(e.g., millions of JSON extensions)
Downside: no easy on the fly editing access(could create this using some basic scripting but not out of the box)
Upside: Free, simple, get full git capabilities and using VScode can leverage VIM bindings...
This was triggered by a blog I saw about Obsidian to take notes as a better option than Notion(which I've never used) but when I saw what Obsidian is I thought this setup was better.

Why did every website/product start looking the same?
text: Every day, I'm seeing a new product or website that clearly had direct design influences from companies like Notion and Linear instead of actually contributing something new. Is this the end of web design?
